intro: Anacheilium venezuelanum, commonly known as the Venezuelan starflower, is a rare flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Venezuela. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils at high altitudes, showcasing adaptations to its harsh environment. Its leaves are narrow and succulent, helping to conserve moisture in arid conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
